title: Discrimination Against Bronze is Brutal.
body:
EDIT2: I am so tired of receiving comments like "Just climb out of bronze. If you can't, you are bad. You deserve to be in Bronze"

First, I ended plat in S4 and currently Gold 2. Second, this topic is about the common attitude towards bronze players, NOT about "imma d1 smurf i no belong here" trash. Please refrain from trying to teach me how to climb out of bronze and feel superior, because this kind of attitude is exactly what I despise.
------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------

EDIT: I find that a lot of people have misunderstood my point. These are some examples I want to address:
> It's more that they don't understand WHY they're there. They don't grasp the concept of this game. They don't understand that this is a TEAM game and they think they can carry it all on their own.

This is a typical stereotype for Bronze players. People who don't accept their own league exist in all leagues, not only Bronze. (maybe except challenger)

> I discriminate people who have been LONG TERM bronze (As in years, not new players) because they want an opinion in the rulings of development when they (When I say they, I mean in my perspective, and the vast majority) have zero clue how to utilize anything in the game to it's best potential.

Okay, I accept Bronze players can't utilize all possible moves or decisions to its best potential. Does it mean they should be discriminated?

> So either you want to win games and therefore you are competitive. Or you do not want to and you should not play ranked.

I never said I don't try my best. I only said "The lowest tier means the players inside are not competitive enough to beat people above them." Diamond is less competitive to Challenger, Bronze is less competitive to Gold. Nothing more.

To make my point clearer, I am not saying we have the right to stay bad. I didn't even bring up Elo hell, but some people just wanna put words in my mouth and switch my topic into a different way.

------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------

Bronze has always been the lowest tier after League system was implemented. The lowest tier means the players inside are not competitive enough to beat people above them. That is all.

It doesn't mean we don't have a brain.
It doesn't mean we  deserve cancer.
It doesn't mean we  should be labelled with humiliating names.
It doesn't mean we are trolls who aim to ruin games.

If I have to define the worst toxicity in LoL, it has to be the attitude people demonstrate towards lower tiers, in which Bronze is the eternal victim.

Think before you try to insult Bronze players. You may find yourself ashamed.

PS. Anyway, I am now a plat in TW, but I was once below 800 ELO in S2 NA (didn't even reach bronze), I believe I've experienced enough insults at that time to share my thoughts.

"Elo Hell" is the sense that there's some inescapable void down in Bronze is a myth.  I saw someone climb from Bronze IV to Silver III just last season.  "Elo Hell" in the sense that Bronze is easily 5x worse than any other division in terms of behavior, including Silver (I've seen both, and even by Silver IV the effect is hugely noticeable), is a very real thing.


BTW, the real issue isn't promos, it's the fact that across the board everyone's MMR is (supposedly) at least a full league below what they used to be ranked.  I mean, I get having a B1 rank and getting demated to, say, B2, but if you're in B1 getting dropped to B5 literally makes no sense.  IF your MMR was REALLY that low you shouldn't even have gotten any LP for winning previously.

Promos working as intended, but the MMR system apparently is either bugged to hell or utterly broken.

"Elo Hell" does exist.  If I can go 8 games in a row twice in a two week window, then get trolled at specific times and still end up in the same tier I started in, there's a problem.

I'm getting +14 for wins and -22 for losses.  Even if I win 3 out of 5 (which for high elo players that's good) I'm still -2 LP's.  So you'll say, "Well your LP gains are based on who you are playing against and their MMR's."  Everyone understands that.  The problem is, I don't choose who I play against.  In effect, Riot could pair me with all 800 MMR players from here till eternity and I can't control that.

I've qualified both of the last seasons B5.  I belonged there last season.  I was B3 with 65 LP's and climbing last season when I lost two tough games in a row.  Was down to ~20 LP's.  I got the network bug and couldn't get into my game.  Lost and was at 0 LP's.

Needless to say after a few 4v5's and some games where these bronze morons went roaming in non-warded jungles getting ganked left and right, I fell to B5.  Climbed back to B3....  Promos.

Many of us may very well never have the aptitude to climb to Gold or higher. Maybe it's our mechanics, maybe it's our decision-making, or our champion-pools, or our ability to control our emotions. Whatever the reason, we may never see a Gold or higher ranking and may never see a Victorious skin.

and THAT'S OKAY. It's not bad, it doesn't mean you've failed at life. If you feel like you want to climb out? Go ahead! If the measure of success in life to you is what Rank you're at in League...you...have a very weird standard and have a hell of a life outside of it, I'd say.

All right, long post.

The issue you're seeing right now stems from the absolutely terrible rehaul of the MMR system which caused a lot of gold and plat players to get put in low silver and bronze for God knows why. These are people used to being grouped with other players who are actually trying to win, people who know what they're doing, people who don't AFK or DC during ranked matches regularly, etc. Many of these people are also newcomers who had never known Elo hell and who, through misinformation, were taught that it doesn't exist.

Now they're experiencing it. Here's the deal: If you're a troll, you'll wind up in bronze. If you leave games, you'll wind up in bronze. If you DC or AFK often, you'll wind up in bronze. If you're the kind of person who picks champions you've never played before in ranked, you'll wind up in bronze. If you're the kind of person who pushes your opponent under his tower then whines at his jungler when he gets ganked, you'll wind up in bronze. If you're the kind of person who's AFK when the match starts until minions spawn, you'll wind up in bronze. If you're the kind of person who starts feeding on purpose or other similar behaviors when your team takes a last hit from you, you'll wind up in bronze. All the worst of the worst winds up in bronze, and these people can single handedly lose games for their whole team. Gold and plat players are not used to dealing with this bullshit.

At least maybe now some people will stop pretending Elo hell doesn't exist.

I think the hate towards Bronze comes from playing with unskilled teammates. Bronze has been associated with being unskilled, since they are at the bottom of the skill ladder.

Therefore, people hate Bronze players because they are the least skilled, and low skilled teammates are the most frustrating to have on your team because they:

- don't listen
- go rambo and dive the enemy team 1v5 and die
- don't learn from mistakes
- don't make a real effort to improve
- blame everyone but themselves
- would rather argue than play

It's not necessarily "discrimination" but I really don't want Bronze level players having input on how the game should work or be changed... because they don't properly understand the game. If they did, they wouldn't be bronze. This isn't some sort of physical sport where you might have a great understanding of the game but are incapable of physically performing at high levels.

This is a game where knowledge and understanding are like 95% of what it takes to win. I would consider people at high elo to most likely be actual geniuses. Whether or not they are friendly or sociable is another thing... but there is no denying they are smart individuals. There is a lot of information to retain in this game, and the higher elo you get, the more you have to know. You can't just jump on an enemy without thinking about it like bronze/silver level... you have to know what the enemy can do EXACTLY. You have to know your own limits. You have to look at levels, items, timing windows, vision, who is where, what summoner spells are burned, what ults have been used, etc... That's just scratching the surface. I can say without a doubt that Bronze players are not thinking about the majority of this stuff.

It's not even about skill, it's about knowledge and taking the time to learn what you need to know.

It's more than possible to escape bronze but what people fail to realize is that sometimes they belong in bronze. Typically a 50/50 win rate means you are where you belong.

50/50 w/l rate isn't the only Factor. There are People in Gold who got 50/50. Other Factors are things like the enemy team's ELO, Your Teammates' Elos, ETC.

If the rest of your team is High elo, the enemy team is likely Higher ELO, too, so if you lose that match you lose less than if they had the same Elo as you. the Opposite is true, too. There is a Luck side of it, too.

Generally a 50/50 win rate is a great indicator if you have 300-400 games and still in the lowest division. Lucks plays a factor in 10-20 games. Not most of them. 

Also, I'm not saying 50/50 doesn't show growth. But if you can't win your provisionals after 50/60 attempts,  you definitely belong in bronze.
